Name: Wonder Woman Game
Description:
From the box top:
"Be the first to capture your assigned spy and link up with the orbiting Justice League Satellite!"

Each player plays a Wonder Woman. This allows for a bit of player interaction. When you land a spot occupied by another Wonder Woman you battle it out. Why would Wonder Woman fight herself? I have no idea.

Name: Word Slam
Description: The idea is to find words for certain categories whose initials are drawn. The referee gives his OK for the best word with a hammer. The pawns are moved forwards after a word has won. The first player with his pawn at the finish wins the game.

Name: Coco Razzi
Description:
From the publisher's website:

Zoom through the jungle at breakneck speed!

Excitement in the jungle. It’s market day and the jungle inhabitants want to sell their fruit. A large troop of monkeys helps them to carry the heavy baskets to market. But watch out - thieves have their eye on all the goodies. The other jungle inhabitants want to steal your fruit. Along with Pongo, the little monkey, they take the nicest fruit out of your baskets! Pongo is lurking somewhere along the long trek through the jungle and suddenly jumps out of the trees – in one fell swoop, your fruit is all gone. And what about you? If you get a chance, you can also try, with Pongo’s help, to steal fruit out of another basket. That’s the way of the jungle. Just take care that you don’t take a coconut by mistake. No-one likes them and you’ll have to keep them. The winner is the person who has brought the most fruit to market. So off you go!
contents

1 gameboard (11 ½ x 11 ½ in./29 x 29 cm), 12 baskets, 1 magnetised monkey, palm tree structures, 32 fruit chips, 2 palm tree tops, 3 market places, 2 coloured dice, 25 action cards, instructions

Name: Quatana
Description:
From the publisher's website:

Ingenious square combinations for far-sighted players.

You need an eye here for what’s important. The winner is the person who forms the most squares with his pegs. It sounds easier than it actually is because you so often overlook the most obvious solution. The game for people with strategic skills and a mind for an unusual eye view!
contents

One gameboard (11 ¾ x 11 ¾ in./30 x 30 cm), 48 playing pegs, 28 winning points (wooden chips), large print instructions

Name: Farmer in the Dell
Description: An easy game for children to play. Each player has a side on the board that shows the Farmer, his wife, child, nurse, dog, cat, rat and cheese. Spin the spinner and match the correct pictures in order. Game pieces are used to cover each picture of the Farmer, wife, child, ect...as they go. The winner is the one who is first to spin and get the cheese.

Name: For the Birds
Description:
There are 4 game rules included in each deck.

This game was developed for two purposes. It was developed with young children and their parents in mind. All age groups can play the same game and experience challenges appropriate to their age. Secondly, we chose birds because they are  important to our ecosystem and have significant habitat overlap with humans. We wanted to create a game where children and adults would learn about the natural world around them. As a result of that learning, we hoped people would go out to explore and protect their natural world.

More games rules are available for free download. Games include basic memory games for children, and more advanced set building and area control games for adults.

Name: Star Wars: Mos Eisley Adventure Set
Description:
From the back of the box:

This desert spaceport city is the ultimate adventuring locale for fans of Star Wars movies.  This boxed set is a guide to the hazard and opportunities to be found in Mos Eisley, with numerous adventures, characters and locations for players to explore.

The game contains 12 metal miniatures.  A 32 page adventure book, a Mos Eisley galaxy guide, a two sided map and dice.

Name: Lowell Thomas Travel Game: World Cruise
Description:
From the rules: "The object of Lowell Thomas' World Cruise game is to circle the globe and return to New York first.

The game includes, as an important part of the play, educational features which teach the players the main points of interest in the many cities and lands which they visit in the course of their travels."

A roll-and-move race game with a bit of money management, different modes of transportation, and trivia questions.  Mule and sailing vessel (for $100), bicycle and tramp steamer ($400), train and cruise ship ($700), and airplane and zeppelin ($1000).  Note that trans-continental zeppelin travel was a real possibility when the game was designed, just before the Hindenburg disaster in 1937.  Each mode gives you a multiplier on your die roll (times 1 through times 4) for movement.  Two decks of cards (blue ones for random benefits and red ones for random penalties) correspond to blue and red spaces on the board.  Don't just go to jail, go to Devil's Island or the fortification of Tokio (sp).  Numbered spaces offer the chance to answer trivia questions in two books (one for Globe Trotters, one for Young People) to win or lose $100.

Name: One Man: Thrag!
Description:
"Slay all of the wizards’ beasts and get Thrag home in time for breakfast."

The red, green and blue tiles are the beasts summoned by the three evil wizards. Thrag must defeat all fifteen of these nasties in twelve hours (turns) or the game is lost. Higher numbers on a tile reflect a more challenging foe.

Track turns by moving the black pawn clockwise around the outer spaces of the 2×2 grid. Twelve turns have elapsed when the pawn returns to the upper-left space. The red, green and blue coins can help Thrag battle against the beasts of a particular wizard.

When Thrag fights a blue foe, he can only flip a blue coin, and so on. The pawns of these colors represent three special weapons at Thrag’s disposal.

The dice are used to randomize strengths on both sides of the battle. Aces count as 1s, Nulls count as 0s.

The black coins track Thrag’s hit points. At game start, three of the coins are in use while the other three are in a face-up Healing Pool. The black tiles represent chances for Thrag to draw coins from the pool and increase his current hit-point total.

Game System

    Piecepack Game System

Name: Landrush
Description:
Your goal is to have the longest, highest value tract of land because the player with the highest score wins. Players draw tokens from a bag to determine where they are allowed to play their pyramids and attempt to take control of a tract of their neighbor's land.

Game System

    Piecepack Game System
    Icehouse Game System

Name: Temple
Description:
A game for 2-4 players
Ages 8 and up
Game Time: 20-45 minutes

Welcome to the Temple of Favors.  You and your fellow players are priests in ancient Ayzactal, attempting to complete your final test, your most difficult test: obtaining the Favor Masks.  The rooms are tight, the doorways are narrow, and rumors increase of a strange curse lurking in the dark corners of the temple.

In TEMPLE, players scramble through the ancient temple, trying to gather the favor masks, all while trying to keep their opponents from doing the same.  The first player to obtain three Favor Masks wins the game.

TEMPLE blends hand management, area control, and set collection with a little touch of "take that."

Contents:
60 Temple Cards
4 Favor Mask Cards
4 Wooden Player Markers
4 Wooden Curse Markers
1 Cloth Temple Play Mat
Rules

www.smallboxgames.com/temple.html

Name: Apples to Apples Junior: Jewish Edition
Description:
This is a version of Apples to Apples designed for kids, with cards optimized for middle-school aged children (Ages 9 and up).  The subject material of the cards focuses on Jewish history, religion, and culture.

The game consists of two decks of cards: Things and Descriptions. Each turn, the current referee selects a Description and players try to pick, from the cards in their hands, the Things that best match that Description. The referee then chooses the Thing that appeals most and awards the card to the player who played it. The unusual combinations of Things and Descriptions are humorous to the extreme, and will quickly have the entire room in an uproar. Once a player has won a pre-determined number of cards, that player wins.

Name: Dicecapades! Kids Version
Description:
This is a party game with simplified mechanics from the original version, DICEcapades.  This version comes with far fewer dice than the original version (13 vs. 133).  Players navigate a board while competing in several activities, including trivia questions, pictionary-style drawing, word and number play, and physical challenges.

Contents: 13 jumbo dice, 20 Actionland cards, 20 Thinkingtown cards, 20 Triviaville cards, writing pad, pencil, 4 character pawns, sand timer, instructions. Ages 6 and up.

Name: Prairie Hazards
Description: This game is a re-creation of prairie life in South Dakota.  Each player chooses an animal from one of five groups (Waterfowl, Upland Game, Small Mammal, Big Game, and Predator) and tries to make it around the board, facing hazards along the way.  After they have completed a lap, they switch to an animal from another group and go again, until they have completed the game with all five animal groups.

Name: The Appreciation Game
Description:
The Appreciation Game

The object of the game is to allow family and friends to become better acquainted and to be aware of and appreciate their own uniqueness while sharing together

Name: L'Aventure mexicaine 1862-1867
Description:
L' Aventure Mexicaine is an area movement wargame about Napoleon IIIs intervention in Mexico to prop up the Mexican Emperor Maximilian from 1862-1867.

Area movement, has an interesting CRT less combat system combined with event chits, with rules pertaining to guerrilla warfare and others.

Name: Wonder Woman Game: Wonder Woman Saves the Amazonians
Description: The first player to rescue the captives of Amazonia wins the game and becomes Wonder Woman.

Name: Fraktarnaspelet
Description:
Most possibly a game published by the transportation company "Fraktarna" as a company-promotional item.

(Translated from Swedish from the box back):
The exciting transport adventure through Europe.

Fraktarnaspelet is a realistic transportation game where each player gets the chance to feel the speed and excitement as a truck driver through a Europe not only filled with nice roads and friendly cosiness.
Here you get to meet grumpy border guards, Bascian guerrilla, mafiosi and a stern traffic police. The reward is the number of points you receive as you deliver your cargo in time to the right place.
The player who manages to first return to his starting position after getting together 50,000 points through diligent freighting is declared the winner.

Name: APBA SuperStars Football
Description:
A children's board game (preschool to early elementary school aged) simulating football using real NFL teams and players.

From the publisher:

"Be the first to make it down the field and score a touchdown with APBA NFL SuperStars! Stop for hot dogs, autographs, and more in a race to pay dirt! Be careful, special wild cards can slow you down! APBA NFL SuperStars includes game cards and pieces with real photos of your favorite football heroes and a game board designed like a football stadium. Introduce the child in your life to football in a fun and easy way! APBA NFL SuperStars is for two to six players ages 4-7"

Name: Suite Life of Zack and Cody Tipton Challenge Game
Description: Roll and move game based on the hit TV show.  Players pick their mover -- Zack, Cody, London, or Maddie -- and using that character's score board, players must be the first to collect "cool" and "school" points. Game features a special three-dimensional revolving door, which is the entrance of the Tipton Hotel where Zack and Cody live.

Name: Schikane
Description:
Content:
board, 12 racing cars out of card board, 3 wooden dice

Each player gets three cars of the same color. 3 dice are the game motor. Each player tries to bring two of his cars as fast as possible to the white aim points. The cars get win points by the ranking of their arrival.
The player with the highest score is the winner.

Name: Ubongo Extrem: Craxy Expansion
Description:
The Ubongo Extreme Craxy Expansion  consists of 70 brand new oversized puzzle tiles (with four different solutions on each tile), each of which requires five (5) pieces to complete. This ratchets up the difficulty to a level that has caused low level brain melting in all but the toughest players.

Comes with a warning on the front cover so that the expansion doesn't accidentally fall into the wrong (read: not brainy enough to play effectively) hands.

Expands:

    Ubongo Extreme

Name: Brontos: Sauriertreffen am Seerosenteich
Description:
Content: board, 4 Brontos, 36 game stones

The Brontos meet near the water lily pond. They are pretty hungry so they eat their favorite food: water lilies. Everyone eats as much as they can get. Let's see who gets the most out of the pond.

The player who catches the most goodies and best memorizes what color they have can win.

Name: Dolphin Game
Description:
Contents: Board, 4 dolphins, 25 shells, 52 sand cards, 2 water stones

The four dolphins want to find 5 pearls, which are hidden under the shells. Do they succeed before the sand covers all free fields, or surrounds a dolphin? If they do the game is won.

Name: Würfel Joker
Description:
Content:
3 dice, a tableau with slide fields from 1-6 and 3 jokers

Each of the players try to achieve dice combinations as printed in the booklet. The fulfilled combination is marked by sliding the number aside. Three dice are used.
The aim is to get the highest score after 10 rounds.

There is also a version No. 2

It is a game of the legendary Krone-game-series for adults.
Families: Series: Krone Spiele für Erwachsene (Ass / Schmidt-Spiele)

Name: Box
Description:
Content:
board, 1 big die, 4 pawns, 20 colored chips

Each player tries to lay down his chips on the alley first. Opposing teams are try to mutually interfering  using an attractive throw-out-system.

Game No. 8 (of at least 12) in a family called "Miniplays".

Name: Oho
Description:
Each player tries to get all his chips to the finish line first. An unusual valuation provides an exciting race until the end.

Game No. 2 (of at least 12) in a family called "Miniplays"

Name: Neu
Description:
Content:
2 dice, 35 wooden chips

Object is to make much money as you can using your chips.
The motor used to play the game are two dice.

The game is No. 9 (of at least 12) in the family called "Miniplays"

Name: Point
Description:
Point is thinkably simple. The basis for this game is the classical Pachisi for which Nuernberger has put together some exciting new versions.
In spite of using dice POINT is not a game of pure chance. The dice bring in some surprising effects. You win with your own head.
In POINT the pawns are dice whose values increase during the game. The aim field is divided in different values. Using  a  combination of aim values and dice values there is an almost endless possibility of many different strategies.

There are the following versions playable:

- Poker POINT
- Happy POINT,
- Lucky POINT,
- Funny POINT,
- Penny POINT,
- Dracula

Name: Aha
Description:
Content: board, 3 big dice, 3 x 6 wooden chips

The players try on there turn to achieve as high a score as possible according to the given rules.

This is game No. 4 (of at least 12) in a family called "Miniplays".

Name: Gin
Description:
Content: board, 2 big dice, 35 wooden chips

This game board is like a kind of flipper, where the players play in their chips, in order to get out some more for themselves.

At the beginning of the game, a chip is placed on each of the three corner spaces of the game board. All other chips are equally distributed to the players. Eventually leftover chips are put on the last space marked with an arrow.

The players roll a die and set a chip on the corresponding space on the game board, 1 beeing the center space. If there is already one or more chips on the space, the player rolls again and moves the entire stack accordingly.
What a player moves over the arrow field onto the table are his winnings.

GIN is game No. 10 (of a least 12) in a family called "Miniplays".

Name: Zug
Description:
Content: board, 2 x 3 big dice, 6 wooden chips

Two players try to decide for themselves in as many rounds as possible how to get the highest scores  possible out of the rolled dice. With a cute rule addition and 6 chips the game will be an exciting race.

This is game No. 3 (of at least 12) in a family called "Miniplays"

Name: Mix
Description:
Content: board, 3 big dice, 2 x 6 wooden chips

On there turn each player tries to get  as high a score as possible by a mixture of the luck of the dice and his/her own decisions.

MIX is No. 7 (of at least 12) games in a family called "Miniplays".

Name: Kreuz & Quer
Description:
Content: board out of leather, 2 dice, 4 x 4 jewels

Each player tries to move his 4 stones from his/her own quarter crisscross to the opposite quarter. There are a lot of possibilities. Therefore, not only is luck necessary, but also skill and courage while trying to take a risk.

Name: Pro
Description:
Content: 3 white dice, 3 black dice, 1 red die

2 players try to roll as many high score rounds as possible. The player with the highest total wins.

Game No. 1 (of at least 12) in the family called "Miniplays".

Name: Grapsch
Description: The sliding cover of the game box contains a number band with characters 1 - 10. With this piece the players can measure reactions of other players in the game. One player holds the number band by the 10 and lets it fall while another player tries to catch it as fast as possible. The number where you caught the wooden piece is the number of small wooden sticks you get for the construction of a playing field. The player with the best reaction wins the game.

Name: Castillo
Description: The aim of the game is to bring as many of your own round stones as possible on to the topmost platform of the pyramid. The game is over as soon as 5 stones are on this platform. The player with the most pawns on top wins the game.

Name: Charon
Description: The aim of the game is to move as many pawns as possible to the opposite corner. The player who has all his still in the game remaining pawns in the opposite corner wins. Even if one player has left only one pawn on the board, he wins the game by having the one pawn in the opposite corner.

Name: Der Mittelstürmer bist du
Description:
With 4 dice the 20 soccer pawns are moved over the board. When a pawns is moved over the basic line of the opponent a goal is shot.
The player with the most goals wins the game.

Name: Bar
Description:
The object of the game is to get rid of the chips on the board with good dice combinations by trying to make as many points as possible.#

This is game No. 5 (of at least 12) in a family called "Miniplays".

Name: Fast 5
Description:
There are 5 cards each representing a person in the community (teacher, firefighter, etc) - one card is a picture of that person - the other 4 match the person. Deal out person cards to all players. Place the rest of the cards face-up randomly on the table. One, two, three go - all players at once must grab the object cards that belong to their person. Whoever grabs all 4 first rings the bell. There are different ways to play this game, to be enjoyed by a wide age-range of players. Players: 2 to 4. Ages 4 and up

The Educa Salent SA version includes 3 different games to play.

Contents: 56 object cards, 14 "career" cards, 1 bell

Name: The Play's The Thing Comedy Set
Description:
An expansion set to the game: The Play's the Thing: Game of  Shakespearean Theater.

The set features cards from the plays: As You Like It, Twelfth Night, and A Midsummer Night's Dream.

Each set allows players to dash and duel around the Globe Theater board, while bringing the characters, the words and the plots of Shakespeare to life in a fun, engaging way.

Each of the three card sets inside this expansion set includes: 
Character Cards -  with questions and facts about the memorable characters of each play. 
Script and Quote Cards - that bring context and meaning to Shakespeare's words. 
Plot Cards -  that help you understand Shakespeare, instead of just reading it. 
Cast Card - that identifies the major players of each featured play.

Expands:

    The Play's the Thing

Name: Spill Your Guts
Description: The pressure's on as student surgeons try to assemble all the patient's organs—without spilling its guts! Using the included 100 true/false question cards, students answer questions about the human body and its organ systems. When they answer correctly, they earn an organ to place in the body tray. When they answer incorrectly, they spill the guts—and start over! Collect the most correctly answered question cards to win. Game features 11 plastic organ pieces: heart, 2 lungs, 2 kidneys, diaphragm with trachea, pancreas with spleen, stomach, liver, small and large intestines and rib cage. Clear plastic body tray measures approximately 16"L. For 2–4 players or teams.

Name: Chuz-It
Description: Chuz-It allows players to choose what they want to do on their turn. With the Flashback process, players get to show off their skills in topics such as Math, Spelling and Geography as well as having fun making up words on a Word Jumble, singing lines from songs in Sing It, making up stories in Story Teller, seeing what you can draw in Blind Art, or trying not to get twisted up on a Tongue Twister and more! Board advancement (or the ability to send others backwards) is based on the difficulty of the chosen talent challenge. Contents of Chuz-It:game board, 240 playing cards, Doodle pad, Pencil, 4 playing pawns, 30 second timer, Instructions.  2 or more or teams, Ages 7 and up

Name: Jenga Halloween Edition
Description: Trick or treat with Halloween Jenga. Build your tower with orange and black blocks. As the tower builds so does the difficulty. Custom Halloween Jenga rules and a special glow-in-the-dark die make the game even more challenging and fun!Roll the die and you are in for a trick... or treat. Roll a "Pumpkin" and reverse the direction of play; roll a "Haunted House" and remove any piece or roll a "Bat" and remove only an orange block. The last player to remove a block without tumbling the tower wins the game. Game comes complete with 54 Halloween-themed hard wood Jenga blocks, 1 custom glow-in-the-dark die, custom Halloween rules and a loading tray for assembly.

Name: Baseball Frenzy
Description: MLB-branded trivia game which features more than 800 up-to-date questions about all 30 teams and their players, complete with team logos and graphics. Most questions are multiple choice or true/false, so players don't need to be an expert to play. Gameplay is much like a real baseball game (hits, runs, outs, etc.) Contents include game board, 4 batting figures, 4 running figures, spinner, scoring pad and rules.

Name: Food Group Bingo
Description: Educational children's game which teaches the food pyramid and nutritional categories of food.  Players spin a spinner to get a category of food (such as "dairy" or "grains").  Players then locate an image of a food on their card that fits into that nutritional category.  The first player to make a row of matches on their card wins.

Name: Cookie Shapes
Description: Preschooler game where players spin, draw cards, and then compete to find the cookie piece with the correct, matching shape.  The spinner and game cards have no writing, so no reading is necessary.  The cookie pieces are nice plastic pieces that resemble actual cookies in various shapes with various decorations.

Name: Healthy Hurdles Nutrition Game
Description: Educational game for children to teach about the USDA's new MyPyramid Food Guidance System and promotes physical fitness. Players spin and move, answer questions, and try to be the first to complete their pyramid.  Includes 6 double-sided food pyramid game boards, 2 double-sided spinners, 2 die and 140 game cards. For 2-6 players.

Name: Pearly Whites: A Dental Health Game
Description:
Educational children game using the theme of dental health.  The gameboard is a large, open mouth, and players move their pawns along the path of the teeth in the mouth.  
Players spin, move, and answer true/false trivia questions about good oral hygiene in order to win.

From the publisher: "Take a bit out of dental visits with this game that's all about your choppers. Learn the names of teeth by moving around the mouth-shaped game board in Level 1 play. Answer true/false questions in Level 2 play to brush up on proper oral hygiene. Dental floss, mouth wash, toothpaste and toothbrush pawns offer another reason to smile. Also includes game board, spinner, 100 true/false question cards and guide."

Name: Cooking Up Sentences
Description:
Players spin and move around a board trying to collect word cards to put together a grammatically correct sentence.  Uses a theme of chefs trying to "cook" up correct sentences using recipes.

From the publisher: "Proper grammar is easy as pie when "chefs" follow recipes to make complete sentences by gathering and correctly identifying parts of speech. Draw a free ingredient card and add the funny word of your choice to the mix. Read complete sentences aloud for giggles and spoken grammar practice. Parts of Speech Cards feature color-coded backs for self-checking."

Name: Monopoly: Los Angeles Lakers
Description: Special-edition Monopoly board features famous Lakers players throughout history. Also contains six collectible Lakers-themed pewter tokens, including: Lakers Logo, Basketball Hoop, NBA Basketball, NBA Championship Trophy, Defensive Player and Offensive Player.

Name: Don't Tickle Elmo
Description: Children's dexterity game themed on the popular Sesame Street character.  Players compete to place plastic "feathers" into holes in the game board (depicting Elmo) and trying to not to "tickle" him, setting of a laughing alarm sound. Ages 3 - 5

Name: Wonder Letters
Description:
This is a crossword-style game for children Ages 6 - 11.  Players build words from letters rolled on dice.  The dice are hollow, however, and are intended to contain small prizes rewarding players for having made words.

From the publisher: "Wonder Letters is the first crossword game where players create words and open WonderLetters to claim hidden prizes. Prizes are customizable - they can be tricks or treats, ranging from motivational stickers or jelly beans to jumping jacks! WonderLetters rounds out the fun with its unique triple-play rule and fast-paced, all-play piggyback round."

Name: Wonder Checkers
Description:
Wonder Checkers is a teaching implementation of Checkers. In addition to the regular checker board, the individual pieces are shaped like small cannisters, which open to reveal messages and prizes. The kit comes with stickers, customizable inserts, prize-tracking score sheets and game rules in quite a readable, logical sequence for new learners.

While the prizes supplied with the game are mere stickers and tokens, the designer suggests using jelly beans!

Wonder Checkers is part of a series which includes Wonder Chess, Wonder Go, and Wonder Letters, all of which are designed to teach standard rules and strategy of these classic abstract games by inserting intermediate rewards and tracking tools to motivate young learners.

On the  reverse side of the board, an implementation of 3-d tic-tac-toe is also included.

Recommended for Ages 4 and up

Name: Children's Bible Trivia
Description:
Players answer questions related to the Bible to move up a rainbow gameboard. There are 2100 questions that cover seven categories (corresponding to the seven colors of the rainbow): Old Testament; History and Geography; Prophets and Miracles; Names; Letters, Numbers, and Sequence; New Testament; and Wisdom. The first player to successfully move up the rainbow and answer an additional question from a category chosen by the other players wins.

The questions are designed for children, Ages 6 and up.

Name: This is your town: Parramatta game
Description:
The object of the game is to move around the Australian city of Parramatta and acquire ten destinations cards by moving around the gameboard. The first player to do so, wins.

The contents of the game box reveal a mounted mapboard showing the cbd (central business district) of Parramatta divided into movement spaces, a pair of six-sided dice, 12 player tokens, a pack of money in different denominations, a pack of surprise cards and a pack of destination cards.

In preparation, each player is given a $100 cash scrip and a token. Tokens are placed in the locations indicated on the board, as are the shuffled surprise and destination cards. The first destination card is turned face up.

Each player takes a turn by rolling the two dice and moving round the board with the object of being first to reach the destination address. A player rolling doubles is allowed to go directly to the destination and claim the card. Each destination card claimed requires a payment of $50. Extra money may be acquired by moving to indicated spaces at a rate of ten times a dice roll (doubled if doubles  are rolled). Spaces marked 'surprise' require a relevant card to be taken by a player and the text is acted upon. A player landing upon another's space may purchase a destination card for $25 from that player or take another turn.

The game ends when one player has collected ten destination cards.

Name: Tank Extravaganza
Description:
Players are famous tank manufacturers of World War II, such as Krupp and Vickers, aiming to build the best tank of WWII.

Game comes with 108 "Magic: The Gathering"-sized cards.

This game is the third in the series from the same game designer, after Naval Competition and Prototype Competition.

Name: Naval Competition
Description:
This is a multi-player card game in which players take part in the naval arms race in the run-up to World War I, aiming to build the best battleship and prepare for the upcoming conflict.

The game comes with 108 cards.

The designer also designed similar games subsequent to this: Tank Extravaganza and Prototype Competition.

Published in old Game Journal #61.

Name: Prototype Competition
Description:
This is a card game. Players are World War II aircraft manufacturers trying to design the best fighter plane of WWII. They can literally put together their dream plane, from jet-engined Zeros to Mustangs bristling with 50mm cannons.

The game comes with 117 cards.

This game is a spin-off from Tank Extravaganza that was published in Game Journal #61, also from the same game designer. The designer also subsequently designed a similar game called Naval Competition.

Published in old Game Journal #64.

Name: Exploring the Depths of Uranus
Description:
From the covers:

Sure...NASA is sending missions to Mars...
...but we're preparing to go...
Exploring the Depths of Uranus!

A mining game of strategy and resource management set at the very edge of the solar system.

Exploring the Depths of Uranus is a planning and resource strategy game where every decision you make will leave profound consequences. Trade, explore, or just shoot anything that moves...the choices are yours to make. Find priceless artifacts, valuable ores, and friendly (or possibly hostile) natives, but remember: this is Uranus, a harsh environment filled with toxic gases and unpleasant surprises.

Name: Monopoly: America's National Parks Edition
Description: This is the classic game of Monopoly with an America's National Parks theme.  It uses images and names of 22 of America's National Parks, and has appropriately themed pewter tokens: Fishing Reel, Mountain Bike, Camera, Tent, Hiking Boot, and Canoe.

Name: Rusz Głową
Description: A simple math children's game. Players place cards on table and make equations. The aim is to get rid all of your cards.

Name: Leszczynowa Zgraja
Description: Players impersonate squirrels who are looking for food: fungi, nuts, pine cones, rowan-berries. Cards are put in one pile and revealed one by one while forming another pile. When someone uncovers a squirrel then he/she must say which kind of food his animal eats. Player takes every card in reject pile with food that he has chosen and lays those cards next to others with this food. The player who collects the most number of cards wins the game.

Name: Bananowy Szał
Description: Game contents 54 cards. 30 with palm trees, 15 with monkeys and 9 with bananas. Players collect cards with bananas.

Name: Mare Bella
Description:
Mare Bella is a children's game that takes place at the sea side. Players have to collect 5 hidden types of sea animals and avoid picking up rubbish such as tires and old boots that have been washed up by the tide. But if they do, they will have the opportunity to rid the beach of such litter, which brings its own reward.

For the younger player, the game has a simple environmental message; for the older player it has a gameplay in which a certain amount of skill and memory is involved.

Basic Rules:

Each player has a 'lotto' board, with space for 5 sea animals: a fish, starfish, crab, sea urchin (type thing) and an octopus. The aim is to be the first to collect all 5 of these, from amongst the square tiles that are laid out over the playing area. Players receive the 'beach bag' from which they draw a round token (same idea as dipping into the Scrabble bag that holds the letters). This token has on it a particular fish type or a particular colour on it. The player then chooses a square tile from the playing area whose upside corresponds in colour or fish type to the round token. He/she flips over the square tile to reveal its underside (which is likely to be different). If the underside is a fish that he/she hasn't collected yet, then the player adds it to his 'lotto' board. If the underside shows a pollution, he/she must collect the pollution. Once a player has three, then he/she may remove them from the game and get a 'free dip'.

Memorising the underside of certain tiles definitely helps, but is not essential, meaning that anyone can play from the age of 3 and up, although the game is certainly illustrated with kids in mind.

The game is soon to be available in the UK, costing around £18. See www.isimat.fr or email muellbauer@lycos.com for details

Name: Tenka Fubu
Description:
Tenka Fubu (War under the sky) is a multi-player game in which players take on the roles of the major samurai clans. The Takeda, Oda and Asai clans are battling for power from the 1560s to the 1570s. There's a political element, as alliances shift back-and-forth, as well as military action, as players' armies contest each other across the board.

Note: å¤©ä¸‹å¸ƒæ­¦ (Tenka Fubu) (under the sky - spread war) refers to the characters on Oda Nobunaga's personal seal that he inaugurated during this period.

Name: Saber y Ganar
Description:
Based on the TV contest Saber y Ganar (To know and To win). Ages 12 and up

3 competitors play, answering questions of general culture during diverse tests.

Content:

- 6 game pieces
- 936 questions cards
- 3 marking boards
- 1 rules book

Name: Snipe It
Description:
From the publisher:

Quick, can you name a flavor of ice cream? Vanilla, chocolate, strawberry... you know tons of answers but can you be the last person to buzz in with a correct answer before the timer runs out? This game turns the concept of "sniping" a bid on eBay into the hottest new game around. With hundreds of questions and a random timer that changes every round, the fun will never stop with Snipe It! For 2 to 4 players Ages 8 and up

Name: Long Live Rock
Description:
From the publisher:

Race against time to unscramble Rock and Roll's greatest moments! Long Live Rock is the un-trivia game that challenges you to put all of the famous people, places, music, and events on the time line of Rock and Roll. Every second counts as you arrange significant Rock happenings in chronological order. Guess the correct year of a Rock happening and go on to win. A great party game for music lovers.

For 1 or more players or teams.  Ages 14 and up

Name: Puppy Surprise!
Description:
From the publisher:

"Find Puppy's Friends before the party ends!

Players take turns rolling the die and matching cards to "find" all the party guests. If you roll puppy's party, you cannot make a match and the party begins. The winner is the first to player to make 5 matches before the party ends! No reading skill required. Contents: 26 cards, die, game rules in English and French."

Name: Elephants or Ants
Description:
From the publisher:
"The fastest, highest, smallest, loudest, greatest and silliest trivia game ever! Each trivia question category - Entertainment, Food, Fun & Games, Mother Nature, Odds & Ends and People - contains 50 fascinating, far out and funny facts. Travel the game board and earn cards by answering the questions correctly. The first to collect 1 card from each category wins! The whole family can enjoy! Great for team play too. For 2-4 players or teams. Contents: game board, 4 game figures, 4 game stands, 300 trivia cards in 6 category boxes, game rules."

Name: Battle in a Bucket
Description:
From the publisher: 
"The ultimate game to communicate, create, gyrate and (sometimes) frustrate! You have 60 seconds to give the best clues - can your team guess the word you're describing? Spin the spinner to determine how you give your clues. This charades, drawing and word game is fun for the entire family and comes with 250 words to guess. For 4 or more players. Contents: 250 word cards, spinner, timer, score sheet, pencils and game rules - all packed in clear bucket with lid."

Name: Fantastic Fairytales Game
Description:
From the publisher:
"Fifteen well-loved fairy tales are colorfully illustrated on game cards. Players travel the game board collecting these cards, memorizing them and placing them in their card holder, face-out so they cannot see the pictures. When you land on a "scroll" space, you must recite the cards you have collected! The first player to collect 7 fairytale cards, land on a "scroll" space and name all 7 cards correctly wins the game. No reading skills required.
Contents: game board, 4 game pawns, 4 stands to hold fairytale cards, 30 fairytale cards, game die, rules."

Name: The Grand Corral
Description:
From the publisher: 
"Answer trivia questions about the wonderful world of horses - the various breeds, how they develop, where they live, how they're cared for, how they're ridden - each time you answer correctly you get to claim one of the 25 horses in the corral to your very own paddock. Collect the most and you win! Contents: 4 game boards (paddocks), 25 horse game figures, 25 game stands, 200 trivia cards, trivia card holder, games rules."

Name: Rupicola
Description:
Contents:

     Board with spinner
     Six tokens
     Cardboard counters:
         24 gates
         18 single keys
         24 double keys
          6 triple keys
    
     Instruction booklet in five languages


Players begin with a supply of gates and keys and move clockwise on concentric paths connected at certain points via gateways.  If someone has blocked a gateway by placing a gate across it, you need one or more keys to open it, then that gate becomes yours.  You can gain more keys by moving away from the center or landing on another player.  First player to reach the center wins.

When there are three or more players, two may negotiate a contract specifying how many gates will be placed during the current turn and where.  A player involved in a contract receives a key for each gate he places as part of that contract.

Rupicola doesn't include trivia questions, but the spaces on the board are color-coded to allow players to incorporate trivia cards from Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition (or any other such question-and-answer set) into the game.  Playing time (average 10 minutes for two players up to 60 minutes for six) can be twice as long when playing with trivia.

Name: I've Got Skunks!
Description:
From the publisher:
"Bluff your way to victory! Players take turns laying matching animal cards face down. Since you can't see them, are you sure they match? Can you trick your opponents into believing you? If you can, you can get rid of your cards very quickly. But, don't get caught bluffing or you'll get skunked! Contents: 50 cards, game rules in English and French."

Name: Dolphin Mania
Description:
Contents:

     Deck of 42 playing cards
     5 reference cards listing the cards' ranks in order
     9 information cards about the animals in the game
     Instructions


From highest to lowest the cards rank Dolphin, Manatee, Alligator, Armadillo, Killer Whale, Sea Turtle, Numbers 12 down to 1, Flamingo, Eagle, Pelican, with two cards of each rank comprising the playing deck.  Players are dealt a hand of seven cards and play out the tricks.  On your turn, you must go higher if possible.  If two like cards are played in the same trick, the second one beats the first.  The winner is simply the player who has the highest card in the last trick.

The instructions say to devise your own scoring method if desired.  They also include rules for a couple of variants in the rummy family.

Name: Federation Commander: Briefing #1
Description:
Federation Commander: Briefing  provides rules updates and new scenarios for use with any of the base Federation Commander Products: Klingon Border, Romulan Border, or Academy.

Briefing #1 includes 6 new ships, two dozen new scenarios, a tactical lesson, and a complete list of all published scenarios to date.

Name: Fargo North, Decoder Secret Word Game
Description: A 1978 The Electric Company board game. Fargo North, Decoder Secret Word Game.

Name: Nourti Champi
Description:
In this light card game, each player is given a mushroom, which he has to feed in order for it to grow. On the menu are  fireflies, salad, trash, ...

Each mushroom has different characteristics and special powers which allow attacking other mushrooms in order to trigger indigestion...

Name: Zip! The Fastest Dice Game in the Universe!
Description: Zip your way to the winner's circle! Shake 'em, Roll 'em, Move 'em!!! The faster you roll 'em, the faster you win. Roll your dice, keep any aside and re-roll the rest. Be the first to roll the correct combination and move. Zip is the fastest dice game in the universe. Ages 8 and up

Name: Conestoga: The Game of the Oregon Trail
Description:
Conestoga is a game in which players can simulate the feeling of the explorers who traveled west in covered wagons.

The object of the game is for players to get from the East Coast to Oregon and make enough money to buy a ranch.  The person who buys the largest ranch wins. Events along the way will help or hinder the players achieve their goal.

Name: Chicken Out
Description:
From the box: "The game of scramblin' eggs!"

Twelve life-size plastic eggs, eleven containing small foam 'yolks' and the other with a foam chicken are placed on a circular battery-powered vibrating plastic tray.  In turn, players select and open one egg.

If the egg contains a yolk, the yolk is kept & the empty egg is replaced on the tray.  If the egg is empty, the player must put one of their yolks in the egg & replace it on the tray.  If the egg contains the foam chicken, the player is eliminated. All other players must yell CHICKEN OUT  & the eliminated player must return the chicken to the egg & replace it on the tray.

The first player to collect the required number of yolks (varies according to the number of players) or the last remaining player is the winner.

Name: Preisfischen
Description:
Content:
1 board of two parts,
4 fishermen,
4 baskets,
20 chips (things that can be drawn out of the water)
4 magnets
1 die

Family trip to the lake: Everyone is eagerly hoping to draw the best fish out of the water. There are fish, of course, 
jewel bags, secret treasure chests and unusual implements.
Who got most of the points by fishing precious things wins the game.

Name: Spider-Man and Friends Hide 'n Seek Card Game
Description: This is a memory and matching game for preschool/early elementary age children with the theme of Spider-Man and his friends (including friendly looking Hulk and Wolverine).  Memory/matching utilizes the characters, shapes, colors, and numbers.  Different rule sets for basic and advanced versions, including the use of "clue" cards.

Name: That's So Raven Star of the Show Trivia
Description:
From the publisher:

Show what you know about the hit TV show "That's So Raven" by answering questions in these amusing categories: That's So Raven, Psychic Eye, Is That for Real' and Who Said What' The first player to reach the end of the game path is named the Star of the Show. Interactive gameplay encourages social interaction and lots of laughter.

Name: That's So Raven "Tell It Like It Is" Game
Description:
Social interaction/discussion style game based on the TV show.

From the publisher: "Join Raven, Chelsea, Eddie and Cory in this fun and "inquisitive" game. Who's your favorite teacher? Who's your crush? What's your favorite pizza topping? Get to know your friends by visiting their "corner" and answering questions.  2 to 4 players ages 7 and up.

Includes game mat, 32 friendship cards, 4 character tokens, 9 ch...ching tokens, psychic spinner and game rules.

Name: Franz von Frosch
Description: Memory game in which players earn cards by feeding the third ball to each frog, while attempting to avoid overfeeding any frogs. The player with the most cards after three rounds wins.

Name: A Batalha do Passo do Rosário
Description:
Free print and play wargame in Strategos #3. It can be downloaded from the Riachuelo website. This small game a battle between Brazilian imperial troops against Argentinian/Orientales (former Uruguay's inhabitants), in Rio Grande do Sul (state of south of the Brazil).

Features a 8.5" x 11" map of mainly very uneven terrain, 50 counters, and concise rules, terrain and combat tables in Portuguese.

Victory Conditions are determined by accumulation of Victory Points for eliminating cavalry, leaders, and artillery scored at the end of 7 turns. 
A player is awarded a Tactical Victory if by the last turn, he has scored 7 more VPs than his opponent. He wins a Decisive Victory if by the last turn, he has scored 15 more VPs than his opponent. 
Any other result is a tie.

Name: Het Grote Babyspel
Description:
An educational trivia game for young and expecting parents. Contains more than 300 questions related to pregnancy and the care of infants.

Each player gets a babycare card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the babycare card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the babycare card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

Name: Pokémon On A Roll Game
Description:
This is a dice game where players attempt to roll patterns of Pokémon with the dice before rolling a Poké Ball and losing their turn.

From the publisher: Chimchar, Turtwig and Piplup accompany players in this exciting new Pokémon game. Roll the dice and set aside any Pokémon character that will help you get the patterns you need on your card. Roll as many times as you want on every turn, but watch out -- if you roll the Poké Ball, your turn ends and you can't score in that round. First player to get all seven patterns wins.

Name: Doodlebops Superstar Count 'n Match Game
Description: This is a children's matching/counting game based on the theme of the popular children's show.  Players spin numbers on a double spinner, count to/locate pieces and look for matches in order to win "CD" pieces.  The first player to win three CD pieces.

Name: Measuring Marathon Game
Description: Players follow spinner directions to try to advance along a board representing a marathon.  The first runner across the finish line wins. Multiple-choice questions quiz kids on measurement tools, length, weight, temperature and capacity, in both customary and metric scales. The marathon theme promotes fitness. Includes 125 questions cards, racer pawns, spinner and guide.

Name: On the Farm
Description:
From the publisher:

At the cow's and pig's home.
Who will help the farmer and his wife to feed the animals?
If the sun is shinning the animals want to pass the time in the meadow, but if it is raining they quickly return to their stables.
Three suggestions for playing, assigning, puzzling and observing closely.
A Game & Puzzle growing with the child.
For 1 player and an adult.

Name: Geister-Stunde
Description:
Content:
board with watch hands, 20 action cards, 4 pawns, 1 wooden die

At midnight the ghosts slip out of the key holes and take their turns walking the halls. At 1 o'clock the spook ends. Which ghost will reach   a key hole? Whoever does remains visible for the next 300 years! The ghosts throw the die and move according to the roll of the die. The watch moves forward and can be moved back by throwing a 1 or 6.

Name: Aufgepaßt-Nachgedacht!
Description:
Turn the disk, and change the position of the pictures! Are you able to find the pairs behind the doors? Find all five pairs one after another, and you will win the game.

This is a variant of Husker Du?, but this game requires a player to find all the matches in one turn.

Name: Reformation
Description: Historical themed card game for 2 players depicting the Protestant break from the Catholic Church. One player is the Protestants, the other is the Catholics. Players use Faith cards to bid for control of different nations. There are separate Faith decks for each player and a shared deck of Nations. Some Faith cards have special powers that affect the Bidding. Some Faith cards have special Event powers that affect the game outside of the bidding. Faith cards have period titles such as Martin Luther, Edict of Nantes, and Council of Trent. A complete copy of the rules is available for free at:  http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Reform.html

Name: Kiproko: L'extension!
Description:
Kiproko: L'extension!, an expansion for Kiproko, adds 540 new words, two sticks, one big blue pearl, and one small red one. In addition, the expansion contains three new variants to the rules:


     One for three "drawers", which allows for games with 6-12 players
     One for team play
     One for three players

Name: Pinguin Cup
Description:
Content:
board, 8 wooden penguins, 5 dice

Each player tries to run through a water landscape with ice floes as fast as possible and to reach the finish fields first. 2 dice give the approximate direction. The last penguin in the round may set back other further in front sitting penguins by using the ice bear. Drifting ice can change the whole game. When a player reaches one of the three finish fields with his penguin, he wins the Penguin Cup.
